item.title: pthreads in C
item.author: xxxx
item.description: This tutorial assumes you know the basic concepts of multithreading. It is based on this short video series by Dr. Brian Fraser Creating single threads The pthread library (POSTIX thread) allows C programmers to use multithreading capabilities. First you must define the <pthread.h> header, and link -pthread when compiling the program. The function to create a thread is the pthread_create(): <pthread.h> int pthread_create(pthread_t *thread, const pthread_attr_t *attr, void *(*start_routine) (void *), void *arg); This takes 4 different parameters:
